data.title: The Faces of Monrovia
data.meta_description: I grew up in the midwest and studied music my entire life. I graduated with a degree in opera performance and started writing songs my senior year in college. Instead of going to graduate school,...
data.text:
Q: Please tell us a little bit about your family.

My son Ronen is 13 and my daughter is 11

Q: Please tell us about your current, past, or future career. What do you love most about what you do?

I’ve been in music since I was four years old! I love it and am still doing it!

Q: What are a couple of your favorite restaurants in our community?

Sushi Nakata and The Monrovian

Q: How long have you lived or worked in our community?

5 years

Q: Who is the most interesting person you’ve met here in our community?

Gina Ammon

Q: If you could travel anywhere in the world right now, where would it be and why?

Prince Edward Island because I’m an Anne of Green Gables Fan!

Q: What is one of your favorite movies? TV shows?

Ozark

Q: What advice would you give to people?

When people go low, go high! Take the high road always! Kindness!

Q: What is something on your bucket list?

To one day find my person!

Q: What is your go to band when you can’t decide what to listen to?

The Cure

Q: What current or former local business makes you the most nostalgic about our community?

Kattywompus – The Doll Shop/Toy Store that closed in the pandemic

Q: If you could choose anyone that is alive today and not a relative, with whom would you love to have lunch? Why? And where locally would y’all meet for this lunch?

Tori Amos – I’m a big fan…probably Peach Cafe

Q: What is your favorite thing about Monrovia or something unique about our community that you like?

The people are super kind, and there’s always parking.

Q: Where do you see yourself in 5 to 10 years?

I see myself in Monrovia, still making music and teaching people how to make their own.

Q: Even for friends or family, what is something interesting that most people don’t know about you?

I was Miss Teen Illinois hahahahahaha

Q: What is the most beautiful place you have ever been?

Zion National Park

Q: What is your favorite month? Favorite holiday? And what is the best single day on the calendar?

Thanksgiving! By far! Eat myself to sleep and then do it again!

Q: What would you rate a 10 out of 10?

Sushi Nakata

Q: Who inspires you to be better?

Gina, my friend…and my mom.

Q: What is one or two of your favorite smells?

Lavender
